meanings.definition: Inlaid work of wood forming geometric patterns
meanings.sent1: The intricate parquetry on the table was made of different colored wood pieces.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a beautiful parquetry design on the wooden floor.
meanings.sent3: The parquetry puzzle was so challenging that it took hours to complete.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a parquetry of thoughts, each one fitting perfectly into the next.
meanings.sent5: The parquetry artwork resembled a colorful mosaic of wood.

meanings.definition: The technique of creating decorative patterns using wood pieces
meanings.sent1: The artist's skill in parquetry was evident in the intricate designs he created.
meanings.sent2: Learning parquetry requires patience and precision to achieve perfect patterns.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her failed attempt at parquetry looked like a jumbled mess.
meanings.sent4: His words were like pieces of parquetry, carefully arranged to convey a beautiful message.
meanings.sent5: The parquetry technique allowed for endless possibilities in creating unique patterns.

meanings.definition: A floor made of small wooden blocks in a geometric pattern
meanings.sent1: The grand hall had a stunning parquetry floor that impressed all visitors.
meanings.sent2: Walking on the parquetry floor felt like stepping on a work of art.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loved to chase shadows on the parquetry floor.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were a parquetry of buildings, each one standing out in its own way.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight streaming through the window created a beautiful pattern on the parquetry floor.
